lieng

Class GIFWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • lieng.GIFWriter

  • public class GIFWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    GIF writer helper class. Support for writing image data to GIF image files. Animation is supported.

    See example usage in the supplementary GIFExample.java file available on Fronter.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Henrik Lieng

    • Constructor Summary

      GIFWriter(int width, int height, java.lang.String filepath, int timeBetweenFramesMS)
      GIFWriter constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GIFWriter

        public GIFWriter(int width,
                 int height,
                 java.lang.String filepath,
                 int timeBetweenFramesMS)
          throws java.io.IOException
        GIFWriter constructor. Establishes the GIF image stream. Notes:

        The default background color is set to Color.WHITE. The background color can be changed by setBackgroundColor(Color).
        The current image is initialized to the background color. Use flush() to draw another background color.

        Parameters:
        width - The width of the GIF image in pixels.
        height - The height of the GIF image in pixels.
        filepath - The path of the image file. Old files will be overridden.
        timeBetweenFramesMS - The time between each image in the animation, given in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if a file stream could not be established.

    • Method Detail

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the background color of the image. Default background color is Color.WHITE. Note that this method only sets the current background color; it does not draw anything to the image. To flush the image, so that it is drawn with the set background color, see flush().
        Parameters:
        color - The color to be set as background.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Flushes the entire image so that it is completely covered with the background color. Use setBackgroundColor(Color) to set the background color.

      • createNextImageNF

        public void createNextImageNF()
        Creates the next image to be read, without flushing the new image. Ensure to call insertCurrentImage(), so that the current image is included in the animation sequence. By not flushing the new image, the new image is initialized to the previous image.
        See Also:
        createNextImage()

      • createNextImage

        public void createNextImage()
        Creates the next image to be read. This method is identical to:

        createNextImageNF();
        flush();

      • insertCurrentImage

        public void insertCurrentImage()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Inserts the current image to the GIF animation sequence. Note that this method only inserts the current image into the GIF sequence; the current image is not changed after this call.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if something wrong happened with the image stream.
        See Also:
        insertAndProceed()

      • insertAndProceed

        public void insertAndProceed()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Inserts the current image to the GIF animation sequence and update the current image to a new image. This method is identical to:

        insertCurrentImage();
        createNextImage();

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if something wrong happened with the image stream.

      • setPixelValue

        public void setPixelValue(int x,
                          int y,
                          java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the pixel value to the specified color at location (x,y).
        Runtime exception will be thrown if the (x,y) coordinate is out of range.
        Parameters:
        x - the pixel location x
        y - the pixel location y
        color - the color at (x,y)

      • fillRect

        public void fillRect(int x1,
                     int x2,
                     int y1,
                     int y2,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Fills a rectangle, with corners (x1,y1) and (x2,y2), with the the specified color.
        A Runtime exception will be thrown if the coordinates are out of range.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the minimum x value in the rectangle
        x2 - the maximum x value in the rectangle
        y1 - the minimum y value in the rectangle
        y2 - the maximum y value in the rectangle
        color - the fill color

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the image stream. This method should be called when the entire GIF animation sequence has been created. The writer object should not be used after calling this method.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if something wrong happened with the image stream.
